content.text: Durante un viaje me alojé en un hostal cuya terraza en la azotea era el lugar donde todo el mundo se reunía.
content.translation: During a trip I stayed at a hostel whose rooftop terrace was the place where everyone would get together.
detailedTranslation: se reunía — would get together; reunirse, imperfect

content.text: Al atardecer subíamos a pasar el rato: charlar, reírnos y jugar a lo que saliera.
content.translation: At sunset we would go up to hang out: to chat, laugh and play whatever came up.
detailedTranslation: saliera — came up; subjunctive after lo que

content.text: Ahí conocí a mucha gente — viajeros de todas partes, con ganas de contar historias y de escuchar.
content.translation: There I met a lot of people — travellers from everywhere, keen to tell stories and to listen.

content.text: Hablamos de mil cosas, jugamos a juegos de mesa y en un momento alguien sacó una baraja.
content.translation: We talked about a thousand things, we played board games and at some point someone brought out a deck of cards.

content.generation_prompt: Rooftop terrace of a hostel at dusk, diverse travellers chatting and laughing, string lights, plants, relaxed atmosphere.

content.text: Un tipo en particular me llamó la atención: Gio, italiano, tranquilo y con una sonrisa fácil.
content.translation: One guy in particular caught my attention: Gio, Italian, laid-back and with an easy smile.
detailedTranslation: me llamó la atención — caught my attention; llamar la atención

content.text: Traía un juego de cartas que guardaba dentro de una caja misteriosa, de madera oscura.
content.translation: He had brought a card game that he kept inside a mysterious box, made of dark wood.
detailedTranslation: Traía — he had brought; traer, imperfect

content.text: Me explicó las reglas: cada uno debía sacar una carta al azar y leer en voz alta la pregunta que llevaba escrita.
content.translation: He explained the rules: each person had to draw a card at random and read aloud the question written on it.

content.text: Eran preguntas sobre la vida, sobre lo que importa de verdad — nada trivial.
content.translation: They were questions about life, about what really matters — nothing trivial.

content.text: Quien sacaba la carta tenía que responder delante de todos, en la ronda, y los demás escuchaban en silencio.
content.translation: Whoever drew the card had to answer in front of everyone, in the circle, and the rest would listen in silence.

content.generation_prompt: Friendly Italian man in his thirties holding a small dark wooden box, small group around him on a rooftop at night, curious and warm mood.

content.text: No llegamos a jugar mucho, solo unas cuantas rondas; pero cada pregunta daba para pensar.
content.translation: We didn't end up playing that much, just a few rounds; but each question gave you something to think about.

content.text: Yo estaba tan impresionado por las cartas que le pregunté a Gio si podía ver el resto de preguntas.
content.translation: I was so impressed by the cards that I asked Gio if I could see the rest of the questions.

content.text: Él me miró con calma y me dijo: «¿Por qué querrías hacer eso?»
content.translation: He looked at me calmly and said: "Why would you want to do that?"
detailedTranslation: querrías — you would want; conditional of querer

content.text: La pregunta me dejó callado; al principio me pareció rara, pero en seguida le vi el sentido.
content.translation: The question left me speechless; at first it struck me as odd, but I soon saw the sense in it.
detailedTranslation: le vi el sentido — I saw the sense in it; ver el sentido

content.text: Si más adelante iba a seguir jugando, ¿para qué querer leerlas todas de golpe?
content.translation: If I was going to keep playing later, why would I want to read them all at once?

content.text: Apenas podemos responder bien una pregunta a la vez; las demás pueden esperar.
content.translation: We can barely answer one question properly at a time; the rest can wait.

content.generation_prompt: Group of people in a circle on a rooftop at night, one person holding a card, thoughtful and attentive faces, string lights, intimate atmosphere.

content.text: Gio me enseñó mucho esa noche, sin dar lecciones: sobre todo por la forma en que hablaba.
content.translation: Gio taught me a lot that night, without lecturing: above all by the way he spoke.

content.text: Hablaba muy despacio, con pausas largas, y todo el mundo quería escucharle.
content.translation: He spoke very slowly, with long pauses, and everyone wanted to listen to him.

content.text: Parecía tener una especie de aura invisible que hacía que la gente se quedara en silencio cuando terminaba de hablar.
content.translation: He seemed to have a kind of invisible aura that made people fall silent when he finished speaking.

content.text: Ese silencio no era incómodo, sino cómodo — como si hubiera espacio para pensar.
content.translation: That silence wasn't awkward, but comfortable — as if there were space to think.
detailedTranslation: hubiera — there were; subjunctive in como si

content.text: Su manera de estar en el mundo me motivó tanto que, al volver a casa, me puse a crear un juego de cartas parecido.
content.translation: His way of being in the world motivated me so much that, when I got back home, I set about creating a similar card game.
detailedTranslation: me puse a — I set about; ponerse a + infinitive

content.generation_prompt: Cozy desk at home with blank cards or notebook, hand writing, warm lamp, creative and reflective mood, inspired by travel.

content.text: Todavía lo uso con amigos: una caja, unas preguntas y la misma magia de escuchar y pensar en alto.
content.translation: I still use it with friends: a box, some questions and the same magic of listening and thinking out loud.
detailedTranslation: pensar en alto — to think out loud

azotea.explanation: Feminine noun. The flat top of a building, often used as a terrace. Muy común en hostales y edificios en países cálidos.

pasar el rato.translation: to hang out, pass the time
pasar el rato.explanation: Expression. Pasamos el rato = we hung out. Often used with friends or in relaxed settings.

baraja.explanation: Feminine noun. A set of playing cards. Sacar una baraja = to bring out / produce a deck.

al azar.explanation: Adverbial phrase. Sacar algo al azar = to pick something at random. Sin orden ni plan.

dar para pensar.translation: to give (you) something to think about
dar para pensar.explanation: Expression. Dar para + infinitive = to be enough for / to lead to. Esta pregunta da para pensar = this question gives you something to think about.

de golpe.translation: all at once, in one go
de golpe.explanation: Adverbial phrase. Leer todo de golpe = to read everything at once. Contrast with doing things Poco a poco.

aura.explanation: Feminine noun (same in English). An atmosphere or presence that someone seems to have. Tener aura = to have a certain presence that others feel.
